龍龍RS
龙龙		㡣龍竜dragon, symbolic of emperor

(Simplified: 龙)
Pictographic: A dragon facing left and bending downwards

heisig_chinese_memo: An ancient Japanese dragon [old], beautiful and terrifying. Here it is depicted standing on a piece of meat (its prey) and a description is written on the right margin. It is said to be like a three toe snake on its feet and can sometimes use its head as a flamethrower (kind of like a sling, but with fire instead of stones).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The imperial radical and the imperial kanji are exactly the same! Wahoo!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Make sure you remember this radical means imperial and you'll remember the kanji meaning too!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Who is the coolest imperial you know? Ryu (りゅう) from Street Fighter. Wait what? You mean he FIGHTS imperials? Oh, okay. Looks like Ryu is the coolest imperial FIGHTER you know!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Ryu kicking the butts of imperial  scum like Bison and Darth Vader.
Ru_Notes: Чаще: 竜 (たつ、リュウ дракон) — упрощённая версия. См. также: 辰 (たつ、シン、ジン знак дракона, 5-й знак китайского зодиака).

Ru_trainchinese:
lóng: (сущ) дракон
lóng: (ключ) дракон
lóng: (графема) дракон как символ императора; предмет, напоминающий дракона; огромная вымершая рептилия
Kanshudo_mnemonic: standing (立) for a month (月) by a serpent is the dragon
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The dragons favorite meal - frankenpooch soup, which he eats with a spoon.
origin_of_ch_char_book: There used to be the alligators in China,. (龍, 龙, long, dragon) depicts a big animal with big mouth () and a long tail (). This animal could be an alligator or a big snake whose teeth are like spears (辛, xin=hsin, hot; bitter). Ancient Hanzi books explain that “a Dragon has scales and is the king of animals.” Therefore alligators that look like they have thick scales could be understood to be Dragons. Dragon is considered a symbol of China. The Chinese refer to themselves as “the descendants of the Dragon.”
humanum_full_description_en:
A golden inscription like a dragon, with a huge head, a big mouth, and a long body flipping upwards. It is a legendary beast that can prosper clouds and rain. The dragon head is similar to the upper part of the phoenix head part of the " phoenix " character, both in the form of " xin ", see " phoenix ". In the Spring and Autumn Inscriptions, the dragon’s mouth became a " flesh " shape, and the dragon's body gradually became a " si " shape. In the late Spring and Autumn period, the survivor Zhong added " brother " as the sound symbol. The Warring States characters may omit the " si ", only from " brother " "Sound ("Shanghai Bo Zhushu I. Clothes" Jane 13). The Han seal either changed the right side of the " dragon " to "隹" or the left side of it to " di ".

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning, "Compilation" 29990: "The dragon is in Fantian, and there is rain". "Fantian" is the name of the place, which means the earth dragon is made (for rain), and there is rain. "Huainanzi. Terrain": "Earth dragon causes rain", Gao Luu's note: "Soup suffers from drought, so make an earth dragon like a dragon, and clouds follow the dragon, so it causes rain." (Refer to Qiu Xigui) "Huainanzi. "Said Lin": "For example, the earth dragon in a dry year." According to Cantonese, there is still the phrase "being in the wind and raining the tail of the dragon", see " quting ". Also used as names of people and places. Also used as a sacrifice object, "Compilation" 21805: "The Royal Dragon Mother", which means the royal sacrifice to the Dragon Mother.

Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning, Yun Zhong: "Qiao (蹻) Qiao (蹻) Qilong", the context means that the dragon shape or dragon pattern of the 蹻蹻 is used as the decoration of the clock frame. Tongjia means " favor ", and Yunfu Zhong: "Don't (pi) show the dragon (pet) light", which means the love and glory of the great dignitaries. "poetry. Xiaoya. "Liao Xiao": "When you see a gentleman, you are a dragon and a light." Mao Heng's biography: "Dragons, be pets." Zheng Xuan's note: "The emperor's grace is shining to be taken to oneself." Another pass is " Gong ", showing respect, Wang Sun Yi Zhe Zhong: "Wen Long (Gong) 㝬 (Shu) Qi (遟)" means gentle and respectful, calm and unhurried. "Book of Rites. "Yuzao": "The grace of a gentleman is Shu Yun." Kong Yingda Shu: "Shu Yun, leisure and elegance." Also used as a name.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are called " Gong ", "Shangbo Bamboo Book I." Jane 13: "Dragon (Gong) will stand (here), and the people will have the heart of Sun (Xun)." "Book of Rites. "Chen Yi": "Respectfully come, the people will have grandchildren." It means that if the monarch treats the people respectfully, the people will obey him (Ji Xusheng).

" Dragon " in the Han silk script is " favor ", "Mawangdui silk script. The 113th line of Laozi Jiaben: "The dragon (pet) is as frightened as the humiliation, and the noble dazhen (the suffering) is as the body", which means that both favor and humiliation make people panic.

"Shuowen": "Dragons, scaly worms are long, can be subtle and clear, can be thin and large, can be short and long, reach the sky at the spring equinox, and dive into the abyss at the autumn equinox. From the flesh, the shape of flying, the child saves the sound. The genus of the dragon is from the dragon." Xu Xuan said: "Xiangqi turns to the flying pan."
humanum_full_description:
甲金文象龍形，巨首、大口、長身翻轉上騰，是傳說中的一種神獸，能興雲降雨。龍首與部分「鳳」字的鳳首上部相似，皆從「辛」形，參見「鳳」。春秋金文龍口訛變為「肉」形，龍身逐漸訛變為「巳」形，春秋晚期王孫遺者鐘加「兄」為聲符，戰國文字或省去「巳」，只從「兄」聲(《上博竹書一．緇衣》簡13)。漢印或把「龍」的右旁訛變為「隹」，或把左旁訛變為「帝」。

　　甲骨文用作本義，《合集》29990：「其乍(作)龍于凡田，又(有)雨」，「凡田」是地名，表示製作(求雨用的)土龍，有雨。《淮南子．地形》：「土龍致雨」，高誘注：「湯遭旱，作土龍以像龍，雲从龍，故致雨也。」(參裘錫圭)《淮南子．說林》：「譬若旱歲之土龍」。按粵語仍有「搞風搞雨屈尾龍」一語，參見「屈」。又用作人名、地名。又用作祭祀對象，《合集》21805：「御龍母」，表示對龍母進行御祭。

　　金文用作本義，郘鐘：「喬(蹻)喬(蹻)其龍」，上下文意謂蹻蹻的龍形或龍紋作為鐘架的裝飾。通假為「寵」，遟父鐘：「不(丕)顯龍(寵)光」，表示大的顯貴的寵愛和光榮。《詩．小雅．蓼蕭》：「既見君子，為龍為光」，毛亨傳：「龍，寵也。」鄭玄注：「言天子恩澤光耀被及己也。」又通假為「恭」，表示恭敬，王孫遺者鐘：「溫龍(恭)㝬(舒)屖(遟)」，表示溫良恭順，從容不迫。《禮記．玉藻》：「君子之容舒遟。」孔穎達疏：「舒遟，閑雅也。」又用作人名。

　　戰國竹簡通假為「恭」，《上博竹書一．緇衣》簡13：「龍(恭)以立(涖)之，則民有孫(遜)心。」《禮記．緇衣》：「恭以涖之，則民有孫心。」表示君主若能恭謹地對待人民，人民就會順服他(季旭昇)。

　　漢帛書「龍」通假為「寵」，《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本》第113行：「龍(寵)辱若驚，貴大梡(患)若身」，表示得寵和受辱都使人驚慌，重視身體一如重視大患(陳鼓應)。

　　《說文》：「龍，鱗蟲之長，能幽能明，能細能巨，能短能長，春分而登天，秋分而潛淵。从肉，飛之形，童省聲。凡龍之屬皆从龍。」徐鉉曰：「象夗轉飛動之皃。」

Chinese Definition:
Pictographic: A dragon facing left and bending downwards
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • ⿱ Above to below
      • 立 [ lì ] to stand; to establish, to set up
      • 月 [ yuè ] moon; month
①傳說中的一種長形、有鱗、有角的神異動物，能走，能飛，能游泳，能興雲作雨：龍舟。龍燈。龍宮。龍駒(駿馬，喻才華出衆的少年)。畫龍點睛。龍蟠虎踞。
②古生物學中指一些巨大的有四肢有尾或兼有翼的爬蟲：恐龍。
③封建時代用作皇帝的象徵，或稱關於皇帝的東西：龍顏。龍體。龍袍。
④姓氏。
龍頭 [ lóng tóu ]: faucet; water tap; bicycle handle bar; chief (esp. of gang); boss; decision maker; (market) leader (of companies); front end of mud-flow; figurehead on prow of dragon boat 龙船

甲金文象龍形，巨首、大口、長身翻轉上騰，是傳說中的一種神獸，能興雲降雨。龍首與部分「 鳳 」字的鳳首上部相似，皆從「 辛 」形，參見「 鳳 」。春秋金文龍口訛變為「 肉 」形，龍身逐漸訛變為「 巳 」形，春秋晚期王孫遺者鐘加「 兄 」為聲符，戰國文字或省去「 巳 」，只從「 兄 」聲(《上博竹書一．緇衣》簡13)。漢印或把「 龍 」的右旁訛變為「 隹 」，或把左旁訛變為「 帝 」。 甲骨文用作本義，《合集》29990：「其乍(作)龍于凡田，又(有)雨」，「凡田」是地名，表示製作(求雨用的)土龍，有雨。《淮南子．地形》：「土龍致雨」，高誘注：「湯遭旱，作土龍以像龍，雲从龍，故致雨也。」(參裘錫圭)《淮南子．說林》：「譬若旱歲之土龍」。按粵語仍有「搞風搞雨屈尾龍」一語，參見「 屈 」。又用作人名、地名。又用作祭祀對象，《合集》21805：「御龍母」，表示對龍母進行御祭。 金文用作本義，郘鐘：「喬(蹻)喬(蹻)其龍」，上下文意謂蹻蹻的龍形或龍紋作為鐘架的裝飾。通假為「 寵 」，遟父鐘：「不(丕)顯龍(寵)光」，表示大的顯貴的寵愛和光榮。《詩．小雅．蓼蕭》：「既見君子，為龍為光」，毛亨傳：「龍，寵也。」鄭玄注：「言天子恩澤光耀被及己也。」又通假為「 恭 」，表示恭敬，王孫遺者鐘：「溫龍(恭)㝬(舒)屖(遟)」，表示溫良恭順，從容不迫。《禮記．玉藻》：「君子之容舒遟。」孔穎達疏：「舒遟，閑雅也。」又用作人名。 戰國竹簡通假為「 恭 」，《上博竹書一．緇衣》簡13：「龍(恭)以立(涖)之，則民有孫(遜)心。」《禮記．緇衣》：「恭以涖之，則民有孫心。」表示君主若能恭謹地對待人民，人民就會順服他(季旭昇)。 漢帛書「 龍 」通假為「 寵 」，《馬王堆帛書．老子甲本》第113行：「龍(寵)辱若驚，貴大梡(患)若身」，表示得寵和受辱都使人驚慌，重視身體一如重視大患(陳鼓應)。 《說文》：「龍，鱗蟲之長，能幽能明，能細能巨，能短能長，春分而登天，秋分而潛淵。从肉，飛之形，童省聲。凡龍之屬皆从龍。」徐鉉曰：「象夗轉飛動之皃。」

龍字的基本解释

龍
lóng

龍
lǒng
均见“龙”。

龍字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lóng］
［《廣韻》力鍾切，平鍾，來。］
亦作“竜1”。“龙1”的繁体字。“龒1”的今字。
(1)传说中的一种神异动物。身长，形如蛇，有鳞爪，能兴云降雨，为水族之长。
(2)称似龙之动物。
(3)喻指人君。
(4)喻才俊之士。
(5)饰以龙形的。
(6)借指饰以龙形之物。
(7)称形状如龙的事物。
(8)旧时堪舆家称山脉的走势为龙。
(9)指山脉。
(10)俗称龙卷风。为一种猛烈的旋风，中心气压很低。经过水面时，把水吸到空中，形成一条白色水柱，俗又称白龙。行经陆地时，可拔树倒屋，并将尘土吸入空中，形成黑色柱状物，俗又称为黑龙。
(11)上古书体的一种。
(12)高大的马，骏马。
(13)见“龍鍾”。
(14)龙泉宝剑的省称。亦泛指精良的剑。
(15)水草名。荭草。
(16)东方七宿（角、亢、氐、房、心、尾、箕）称苍龙，省称龙。
(17)星名。指岁星，太岁。
(18)古代炼丹术士称水或汞为龙。
(19)传说中的远古官名。
(20)十二生肖之一。与地

龍字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【龍字部】　龍； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1536第33
〔古文〕竜???㰍?龒䰱【唐韻】【集韻】力鍾切【韻會】【正韻】盧容切，?音籠。【說文】龍，鱗蟲之長，能幽能明，能細能巨，能短能長，春分而登天，秋分而潛淵。【廣雅】有鱗曰蛟龍，有翼曰應龍，有角曰虯龍，無角曰螭龍，未升天曰蟠龍。【本草註】龍耳虧聰，故謂之龍。【易·乾卦】時乗六龍以御天。　又星名。【左傳·僖五年】龍尾伏辰。【疏】角亢氐房心尾箕爲蒼龍之宿。又【襄二十八年】龍，宋鄭之星也。　又山名。龍門，在河東，見【禹貢】。龍山，見【山海經】。封龍，見【括地志】。　又邑名。【左傳·成二年】齊侯伐我北鄙，三日取龍。【註】龍，魯邑。在泰山博縣西南。又【前漢·地理志】燉煌郡有龍勒縣。　又官名。【左傳·昭十七年】太皡氏以龍紀，故爲龍師，而龍名。　又句龍。【左傳·昭二十九年】共工氏有子曰句龍。　又馬名。《周禮·廋人》馬八尺以上爲龍。【禮·月令】駕蒼龍。　又龍輔，玉名。【左傳·昭二十九年】公賜公衍羔裘，使獻龍輔於齊侯。　又草名。【詩·鄭風】隰有游龍。【陸璣·草木疏】

Basic explanation of words
Long
lóng
Long
lǒng
See also "Dragon".
Long
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lóng］
["Guangyun" force the clock to cut, Pingzhong, come. ]
Also known as "Long 1". Traditional characters for "龙1". The present word for "龒1".
(1) A mysterious animal in the legend. Long, shaped like a snake, with scales and claws, it can thrive in clouds and rain, and is the longest of aquatic people.
(2) Animals called dragons.
(3) The metaphor refers to the prince.
(4) Yu is a talented person.
(5) Decorated in the shape of a dragon.
(6) A dragon-shaped object is decorated with a finger.
(7) It is said that something shaped like a dragon.
(8) In the old days, the geomancyists called the trend of the mountains as dragons.
(9) Refers to mountains.
(10) Commonly known as tornado. It is a violent cyclone with very low central pressure. When passing over the water, it sucks water into the air to form a white water column, commonly known as a white dragon. When traveling on land, trees can be pulled up and down, and dust can be sucked into the air to form black pillars, commonly known as black dragons.
(11) A type of ancient calligraphy.
(12) A tall horse, a steed.
(13) See "Dragon Bell".
(14) The provincial name of Longquan Sword. Also refers to a sophisticated sword.
(15) The name of aquatic plants. Orientia.
(16) Dongfang Qisu (corner, kang, di, room, heart, tail, Ji) is called Canglong, and province is called dragon.
(17) Star name. Refers to Sui Xing, Tai Sui.
(18) Ancient alchemists called water or mercury a dragon.
(19) The ancient official name in the legend.
(20) One of the Chinese Zodiac. And land
Long
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Ji 2] [Dragon Character Department] 　龙; Kangxi strokes: 16; page number: page 1536 33
〔古文〕竜???㰍龒䰱【Tang Yun】【Jiyun】Li Zhongqie 【Yunhui】【Zhengyun】Lu Rongqie, the sound cage. [Speaking text] The dragon is as long as a scaly worm, can be subtle and bright, can be thin and large, can be short and long, and reach the sky at the vernal equinox, and deep in the abyss at the autumnal equinox. [Guangya] A dragon with scales, a dragon with wings, a horned dragon with horns, a horned dragon without horns, and a beaury dragon without horns. [Materia Medica] Long ears are deficient in Cong, so it is called a dragon. 【Yi·Qian Gua】Take six dragons to protect the sky.　Also star name. [Zuo Zhuan·Xi Five Years] Longwei Fuchen. 【Sparse】The corner kang di atrial heart tail pan is the place of Canglong. Also [Xiang Twenty-Eight Year] Long, Song Zhengzhixing also.　Also the name of the mountain. Longmen, in Hedong, see [Yugong]. Longshan, see [Shan Hai Jing]. Fenglong, see 【Enclosed Topography】.　Also known as the town. [Zuo Zhuan·2nd Year] Qi Hou defeated me and took the dragon in three days. [Note] Long, Lu Yi. In the southwest of Taishanbo County. Also [Pre-Han Geography] Xuanhuang County has Longle County.　Also official name. [Zuo Zhuan·17th Year of Zhao] The Taigao family was based on the Dragon Ji, so it was the Dragon Master, and the name of the dragon.　Another sentence. [Zuo Twenty-nine Years] Gonggong has a son called Julong.　Also the name of the horse. "Zhou Li·Xinren" Ma Bachi and above are dragons. 【Ritual·Monthly Order】Drive the Canglong.　Yonglongfu, Yuming. [Zuo Twenty-ninth year] Gong Yan Gaoqi was bestowed by Gong, and Xianlong was assisted by Qihou.　Also cursive name. [Poetry·Zheng Feng] Xi has a roaming dragon. 【Lu Ji·Sparse vegetation】

Radicals: 龍  (imperial)
Meaning Mnemonic
The imperial radical and the imperial kanji are exactly the same! Wahoo!
Make sure you remember this radical means imperial and you'll remember the kanji meaning too!
Reading Mnemonic
Who is the coolest imperial you know? Ryu (りゅう) from Street Fighter. Wait what? You mean he FIGHTS imperials? Oh, okay. Looks like Ryu is the coolest imperial FIGHTER you know!
Picture Ryu kicking the butts of imperial scum like Bison and Darth Vader.
